Posts.Content: Dec 7, 2017 05:27PM Convallaria wrote: so I had my appointment and my US and I’m not sure what to do with the results... the US says birads 3 and possible galactocele but I feel like they asked me too many times if I was lactating and just wrote it off as such... the results say :  1.6 cm hypoechoic/heterogeneous nodule in the right 10 o'clock axis in the area of palpable concern, possibly representing a galactocele  I’m considering requesting a biopsy anyway because I swear it doesn’t seem milk related to me!
Posts.Title: Appt on Thurs for large hard lump- super nervous!! Convallaria Peacetoallcuzweneedit

Posts.Content: Convallaria wrote: Hi! So I googled and started reading posts on this forum and it’s been helping me a lot with researching (I’m autistic and research relaxes me)... I’m 29, I’ve been nursing 6 years and I’m currently still nursing my 2 yr old. I know my boobs. I’ve had mastitis or huge clogs 15 times (most times I treated myself since it’s just common for me at this point). What I found a few weeks ago is not a clog and I’m pretty worried. I had a clog 4 weeks ago and I worked it out no problem but since working that one out I felt a hard fibrous veiny lump to the right of my Areola on my right breast. I do monthly checks and there’s never been anything there. It’s shaped like a Pea with a thick tube off one side? No pain at all. I have an appointment Thursday at 10:30 and a sono after (my mom had a rare choroidal melanoma tumor so I am naturally a worst case scenario planner). Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Appt on Thurs for large hard lump- super nervous!! Convallaria Peacetoallcuzweneedit
